pages.text: Particle Chambers are the multiblocks where you actually do things with particles, like bombard items with particles, collide particles together and create new particles. They are the second key ingredient in any accelerator system (the first being accelerators themselves).
Particle chambers in a system processing multiple different items.

pages.title: Construction
pages.text: The outside (casing) of all particle chambers are made out of Particle Chamber Casing or Particle Chamber Glass. In the casing you need: $(li)The particle Chamber's controller$(li)At least one Particle Chamber Energy Port.$(br2)Inside particle chambers there are particle chamber beam blocks and the particle chamber block itself.
The arrangement of these depends on the type of particle chamber. Around these detector blocks can be placed.$(br2)Below a typical arrangement of a target chamber with 3 output beam ports.

pages.title: Detectors
pages.text: Detectors are placed inside particle chambers to increase the chambers efficiency. The chambers efficiency affects how the particle chamber works. Generally the higher the efficiency the faster items are crafted and the more particles outputted. There are different types of detectors, each increases the efficiency and the power usage of the chamber specified on their tooltips.

They must be within a certain distance of a particle chamber block to work also shown on their tooltip. $(l)Detectors can increase the energy use of the particle chambers drastically$(). Below a typical arrangement of a target chamber with detectors.

pages.title: Cross-Section
pages.text: Efficiency and Cross-Section are 2 important values for particle chambers. Cross-Section $(l)σ$() depends on the recipe preformed (can be seen in JEI), it can be thought of as what percentage of particles perform the reaction. Efficiency $(l)η$() depends on the particle chamber and modifies the cross-section. This new 'effective' cross-section $(l)Σ$() can only be 100% at max, this means all particles perform the reaction.
Because of this detectors can only increase the effective cross-section to this level, anymore detectors do nothing and are in fact a waste of power.
